item.title: One of Bolt’s proposed new backers, The London Fund, has been scrubbing its web page
item.dc:creator: Mary Ann Azevedo
item.description:
One-click checkout tech company Bolt is still waiting to find out if shareholders will sign off on a proposed funding round with stipulations that founder Ryan Breslow would return as CEO. In the meantime, Axios’ Dan Primack did some digging around on The London Fund, a firm that is supposed to provide up to $250 million in “marketing credits” […]

item.title: OpenAI reportedly in talks to close a new funding round at $100B+ valuation
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description:
Whatever size the tranche ends up being it'll be OpenAI's biggest outside infusion of capital since January 2023.

item.title: Reddit back online after a software update took it down
item.dc:creator: Maxwell Zeff
item.description:
Reddit’s mobile and web applications went down on Wednesday afternoon, with more than 150,000 users reporting outages on Downdetector as of 1:30 p.m. in San Francisco. When trying to access Reddit’s homepage, users were met with the message, “Server error. Try again later.” The company itself reported a “degraded status” for Reddit.com as of 1:16 […]

item.title: OpenAI’s Converge 2 program has been shrouded in mystery
item.dc:creator: Dominic-Madori Davis, Marina Temkin
item.description:
For months, a tech forum ran wild asking if the Converge 2 accelerator program actually happened. We finally found out.

item.title: Bluesky adds ‘anti-toxicity’ tools and aims to integrate ‘a Community Notes-like’ feature in the future
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description:
Bluesky on Wednesday introduced the ability to hide replies, as well as a way to detach your original post from someone's quote post.

item.title: Fluid Truck’s board ousted its sibling co-founders amid allegations of mismanaging funds
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Bellan
item.description:
Fluid Truck, a startup that was founded to disrupt the commercial vehicle rental industry, has ousted its sibling co-founders — CEO James Eberhard and chief legal counsel Jenifer Snyder — according to sources familiar with the matter. The shakeup, which employees have described as a hostile takeover, was led by two minority investors on the […]

item.title: Threads deepens its ties to the open social web, aka the ‘fediverse’
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description:
Meta announced Wednesday that users on Threads will be able to see fediverse replies on other posts besides their own.

item.title: Polestar is getting a new CEO amid EV sales slump
item.dc:creator: Kirsten Korosec
item.description:
Just weeks ago, during an interview with TechCrunch, Thomas Ingenlath laid out his plan to turn Polestar into a self-sustaining company. Now, he’s out.  Polestar said Tuesday Ingenlath has resigned as CEO, a position he has held since the EV startup spun out of Volvo in 2017. He will be replaced by Michael Lohscheller, who was […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Midjourney says it’s ‘getting into hardware’
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description:
Midjourney, the AI image-generating platform that’s reportedly raking in more than $200 million in revenue without any VC investment, is getting into hardware. The company made the announcement in a post on X on Wednesday. Its new hardware team will be based in San Francisco, it revealed. As for what hardware Midjourney, which has a […]

item.title: This Week in AI: AI is rapidly being commoditized
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description:
Hiya, folks, welcome to TechCrunch’s regular AI newsletter. If you want this in your inbox every Wednesday, sign up here. Say what you will about generative AI. But it’s commoditizing — or, at least, it appears to be. In early August, both Google and OpenAI slashed prices on their budget-friendliest text-generating models. Google reduced the […]

item.title: SEC takes aim at NFT marketplace OpenSea
item.dc:creator: Maxwell Zeff
item.description:
OpenSea, which calls itself the “world’s largest” nonfungible token (NFT) marketplace, received a Wells notice from the SEC, the company said in a blog post Wednesday, indicating the regulator may soon bring a lawsuit against the company. In a tweet, CEO Devin Finzer says the SEC is claiming NFTs on OpenSea’s platform are unregistered securities. […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Ex-Twitter CISO Lea Kissner appointed as LinkedIn security chief
item.dc:creator: Zack Whittaker
item.description:
Kissner previously served as Twitter's chief information security officer, and held senior security and privacy positions at Apple, Google, and Lacework.

A complete list of all the known layoffs in tech, from Big Tech to startups, broken down by month throughout 2024.

item.title: Tesla’s Supercharger network is still unavailable to non-Tesla EVs
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Bellan
item.description:
It’s been more than a year since Tesla agreed to open its Supercharger network to electric vehicles from other automakers, like General Motors and Ford. But Tesla’s network of nearly 30,000 fast-charging plugs in the U.S. and Canada still remains unavailable to non-Tesla vehicles, according to a New York Times report.  The delays come amid […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Tumblr to move its half a billion blogs to WordPress
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description:
Tumblr is making the move to WordPress. After its 2019 acquisition by WordPress.com parent company Automattic in a $3 million fire sale, the new owner has focused on improving Tumblr’s platform and growing its revenue. Now Automattic will shift Tumblr’s back end over to WordPress, Automattic said in a blog post published on Wednesday. The […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Google says it’s fixed Gemini’s people-generating feature
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description:
Back in February, Google paused its AI-powered chatbot Gemini’s ability to generate images of people after users complained of historical inaccuracies. Told to depict “a Roman legion,” for example, Gemini would show an anachronistic group of racially diverse soldiers while rendering “Zulu warriors” as stereotypically Black. Google CEO Sundar Pichai apologized, and Demis Hassabis, the co-founder of Google’s AI […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: TechCrunch Minute: The company behind Pokémon GO wants to build a 3D map of the world
item.dc:creator: Amanda Silberling
item.description:
Niantic wants to build a richer 3D map of the world, and it’ll use its 2021 acquisition of Scaniverse to do that.  After a major update to the app, Scaniverse 4 will allow iOS users to scan landmarks by walking around them and recording video for about one to three minutes. Niantic has had functionality […]

item.description:
Exclusive: Millennium Space Systems will soon have a new CEO as Jason Kim has departed the company, TechCrunch has learned.

item.description:
